description/child_mortality_0_5_year_old: Death of children under five years of age per 1,000 live births
description/life_expectancy_years: The average number of years a newborn child would live if current mortality patterns were to stay the same.
description/aid_given_2007_us: Total amount of allocable aid for official development assistance (ODA) given by the donor countries, expressed in constant 2007 US$.
description/aid_given_per_person_2007_us: Total amount of official development assistance (ODA) aid that has been given during this year divided by the population of the country (2007 US$)
description/aid_given_percent_of_gni: Percentage of the gross national income (GNI) of each recepient country that has been given as official development assistance (ODA) aid during this year.
description/water_and_sanitation_aid_giv: Percentage of total allocable aid for official development assistance (ODA) given by the donor countries that has been used in water and sanitation.
description/economical_infrastructure_ai: Percentage of total allocable aid for official development assistance (ODA) given by the donor countries that has been used in economical infrastructures.
description/production_sector_aid_given_: Percentage of total allocable aid for official development assistance (ODA) given by the donor countries that has been used in production sectors, including agriculture and industry, etc.
description/multisector_cross_cutting_ai: Percentage of total allocable aid for official development assistance (ODA) given by the donor countries that has been used in multisector cross-cutting.
description/education_aid_given_percent_: Percentage of total allocable aid for official development assistance (ODA) given by the donor countries that has been used in education.
description/health_aid_given_percent_of_: Percentage of total allocable aid for official development assistance (ODA) given by the donor countries that has been used in health.
description/population_policies_aid_give: Percentage of total allocable aid for official development assistance (ODA) given by the donor countries that has been used in population policies/programs and reproductive health.
description/government_and_society_aid_g: Percentage of total allocable aid for official development assistance (ODA) given by the donor countries that has been used in government and civil societies.
description/other_social_services_aid_gi: Percentage of total allocable aid for official development assistance (ODA) given by the donor countries that has been used in other social infrastructures and services.
description/aid_received_total_us_inflat: The sum of aid each recepient country gets during this year from all donor countries in all sectors, expressed in fixed 2007 US$.
description/aid_received_per_person_curr: The average amount of aid each person in the recepient country gets during this year from all donor countries in all sectors, expressed in current US$.
description/aid_received_percent_of_gni: Percentage of the gross national income (GNI) of each recepient country that comes from official development assistance (ODA) aid during this year.
description/dollar_billionaires_per_mill: Number of billionaires among every 1 million people in the country of their citizenship, calculation based on data from Forbes.com
description/average_age_of_dollar_billio: The average age of billionaires in the country of their citizenship, calculation based on data from Forbes.com
description/total_number_of_dollar_billi: Total number of billionaires in the country of their citizenship, provided by Forbes.com
description/gdppercapita_us_inflation_ad: GDP per capita in exchange rate terms and adjusted for inflation (2000 US$)
description/gdpperemployee_us_inflation_: The average Gross Domestic Products per each employee during the given year, counted by constant 1990 US$.
description/gdpperworking_hour_us_inflat: The average Gross Domestic Products per hour per person, counted by constant 1990 US$.
description/gdppercapita_growth_over_nex: Average growth in GDP per capita over the subsequent 10 years, i.e. the data for 1980 concerns the average growth 1980-90. The data is based on income per person v12. Projections after 2005.
description/gdppercapita_growth_percent_: Annual growth in GDP pc. Based on World Bank data.
description/total_gni_ppp_current_intern: PPP GNI (formerly PPP GNP) is gross national income converted to international dollars using purchasing power parity rates. An international dollar has the same purchasing power over GNI as a U.S. dollar has in the United States.
description/gnipercapita_atlasmethod_cur: GNI per capita, Atlas method (current US$)
description/inequality_index_gini: Gini index measures the extent to which the distribution of income (or, in some cases, consumption expenditure) among individuals or households within an economy deviates from a perfectly equal distribution. A Lorenz curve plots the cumulative percentages of total income received against the cumulative number of recipients, starting with the poorest individual or household. The Gini index measures the area between the Lorenz curve and a hypothetical line of absolute equality, expressed as a percentage of the maximum area under the line. Thus a Gini index of 0 represents perfect equality, while an index of 100 implies perfect inequality.
description/income_share_of_richest_10pe: Percentage share of income or consumption is the share that accrues to subgroups of population indicated by deciles or quintiles. Percentage shares by quintile may not sum to 100 because of rounding.
description/income_share_of_richest_20pe: Percentage share of income or consumption is the share that accrues to subgroups of population indicated by deciles or quintiles. Percentage shares by quintile may not sum to 100 because of rounding.
description/income_share_of_2nd_richest_: Percentage share of income or consumption is the share that accrues to subgroups of population indicated by deciles or quintiles. Percentage shares by quintile may not sum to 100 because of rounding.
description/income_share_of_middle_20per: Percentage share of income or consumption is the share that accrues to subgroups of population indicated by deciles or quintiles. Percentage shares by quintile may not sum to 100 because of rounding.
description/income_share_of_2nd_poorest_: Percentage share of income or consumption is the share that accrues to subgroups of population indicated by deciles or quintiles. Percentage shares by quintile may not sum to 100 because of rounding.
description/income_share_of_poorest_20pe: Percentage share of income or consumption is the share that accrues to subgroups of population indicated by deciles or quintiles. Percentage shares by quintile may not sum to 100 because of rounding.
description/income_share_of_poorest_10pe: Percentage share of income or consumption is the share that accrues to subgroups of population indicated by deciles or quintiles. Percentage shares by quintile may not sum to 100 because of rounding.
description/inflation_annual_percent: Inflation as measured by the annual growth rate of the GDP implicit deflator shows the rate of price change in the economy as a whole. The GDP implicit deflator is the ratio of GDP in current local currency to GDP in constant local currency.
description/investments_percent_of_gdp: Outlays on additions to the fixed assets of the economy plus net changes in the level of inventories. Fixed assets include land improvements (fences, ditches, drains, and so on); plant, machinery, and equipment purchases; and the construction of roads, railways, and the like, including schools, offices, hospitals, private residential dwellings, and commercial and industrial buildings. Inventories are stocks of goods held by firms to meet temporary or unexpected fluctuations in production or sales, and 'work in progress'.
description/tax_revenue_percent_of_gdp: Tax revenue refers to compulsory transfers to the central government for public purposes. Certain compulsory transfers such as fines, penalties, and most social security contributions are excluded. Refunds and corrections of erroneously collected tax revenue are treated as negative revenue.
description/foreign_direct_investment_ne: Net inflows of investment to acquire a lasting management interest (10 percent or more of voting stock) in an enterprise operating in an economy other than that of the investor. It is the sum of equity capital, reinvestment of earnings, other long-term capital, and short-term capital as shown in the balance of payments, as a percentage of GDP.

Net outflows of investment to acquire a lasting management interest (10 percent or more of voting stock) in an enterprise operating in an economy other than that of the investor. It is the sum of equity capital, reinvestment of earnings, other long-term capital, and short-term capital as shown in the balance of payments, as a percentage of GDP.
description/patent_applications_total: Patents are documents issued by a government office that describe an invention and create a legal situation in which the patented invention can normally be exploited only by or with the authorization of the patent holder. The protection is generally limited to 20 years.
description/patents_granted_total: Patents are documents issued by a government office that describe an invention and create a legal situation in which the patented invention can normally be exploited only by or with the authorization of the patent holder. The protection is generally limited to 20 years.
description/patents_in_force_total: Patents are documents issued by a government office that describe an invention and create a legal situation in which the patented invention can normally be exploited only by or with the authorization of the patent holder. The protection is generally limited to 20 years.
description/poverty_percent_people_below: The percentage of people living on less than $2 (2005 purchasing power parity dollars).
description/rural_poverty_percent_rural_: Poverty headcount ratio at rural poverty line (% of rural population)
description/urban_poverty_percent_urban_: Poverty headcount ratio at urban poverty line (% of urban population)
description/extreme_poverty_percent_peop: The percentage of people living on less than $1.25 (2005 purchasing power parity dollars).
description/agriculture_percent_of_gdp: Agriculture includes forestry, hunting, and fishing, as well as cultivation of crops and livestock production. Value added is the net output of a sector after adding up all outputs and subtracting intermediate inputs. It is calculated without making deductions for depreciation of fabricated assets or depletion and degradation of natural resources.
description/industry_percent_of_gdp: Industry comprises value added in mining, manufacturing (also reported as a separate subgroup), construction, electricity, water, and gas. Value added is the net output of a sector after adding up all outputs and subtracting intermediate inputs. It is calculated without making deductions for depreciation of fabricated assets or depletion and degradation of natural resources.
description/services_percent_of_gdp: Services include wholesale and retail trade (including hotels and restaurants), transport, and government, financial, professional, and personal services such as education, health care, and real estate services. Also included are imputed bank service charges, import duties, and any statistical discrepancies noted by national compilers as well as discrepancies arising from rescaling.
description/exports_percent_of_gdp: Exports of goods and services represent the value of all goods and other market services provided to the rest of the world. They include the value of merchandise, freight, insurance, transport, travel, royalties, license fees, and other services, such as communication, construction, financial, information, business, personal, and government services. They exclude labor and property income (formerly called factor services) as well as transfer payments.
description/imports_percent_of_gdp: Imports of goods and services represent the value of all goods and other market services received from the rest of the world. They include the value of merchandise, freight, insurance, transport, travel, royalties, license fees, and other services, such as communication, construction, financial, information, business, personal, and government services. They exclude labor and property income (formerly called factor services) as well as transfer payments.
description/arms_exports_us_inflation_ad: Data for some countries are based on partial or uncertain data or rough estimates. Arms transfers cover the supply of military weapons through sales, aid, gifts, and those made through manufacturing licenses. Data cover major conventional weapons such as aircraft, armored vehicles, artillery, radar systems, missiles, and ships designed for military use. Excluded are transfers of other military equipment such as small arms and light weapons, trucks, small artillery, ammunition, support equipment, technology transfers, and other services. In 1990 prices.
description/arms_imports_us_inflation_ad: Data for some countries are based on partial or uncertain data or rough estimates. Arms transfers cover the supply of military weapons through sales, aid, gifts, and those made through manufacturing licenses. Data cover major conventional weapons such as aircraft, armored vehicles, artillery, radar systems, missiles, and ships designed for military use. Excluded are transfers of other military equipment such as small arms and light weapons, trucks, small artillery, ammunition, support equipment, technology transfers, and other services.In 1990 prices,
description/total_gdp_ppp_inflation_adju: PPP GDP is gross domestic product converted to international dollars using purchasing power parity rates. A PPP dollar has the same purchasing power over GDP as the U.S. dollar has in the United States. Data are in constant 2005 international dollars.
description/high_technology_exports_perc: High-technology exports are products with high R&D intensity, such as in aerospace, computers, pharmaceuticals, scientific instruments, and electrical machinery.
description/merchandise_trade_percent_of: Merchandise trade as a share of GDP is the sum of merchandise exports and imports divided by the value of GDP, all in current U. S. dollars.
description/trade_balance_us_not_inflati: The value of exports of goods and services minus the value of imports of goods and services. Measured in US$.
description/trade_balance_percent_of_gdp: External balance on goods and services (formerly resource balance) equals exports of goods and services minus imports of goods and services (previously nonfactor services).
description/hourly_compensation_us: Amount of financial compensation for each non-working hour, counted by US$.
description/working_hours_per_week: Total amount of yearly working hours devided by 52 weeks.
description/market_value_of_listed_compa: Market capitalization (also known as market value) is the share price times the number of shares outstanding. Listed domestic companies are the domestically incorporated companies listed on the country's stock exchanges at the end of the year. Listed companies does not include investment companies, mutual funds, or other collective investment vehicles.
description/military_expenditure_percent: Data, from SIPRI, are derived from the NATO definition, which includes all current and capital expenditures on the armed forces, including peacekeeping forces; defense ministries and other government agencies engaged in defense projects; paramilitary forces, if these are judged to be trained and equipped for military operations; and military space activities.
description/math_achievement_4th_grade: Average score in the international TIMSS test for children in the 4th grade.
description/math_achievement_8th_grade: Average score in the international TIMSS test for childeren in the 8th grade.
description/ratio_of_girls_to_boys_in_pr: Break in series between 1997 and 1998 due to change from International Standard Classification of Education (ISCED76) to ISCED97. Recent data are provisional. Ratio of girls to boys in primary and secondary education is the percentage of girls to boys enrolled at primary and secondary levels in public and private schools.
description/ratio_of_young_literate_fema: Ratio of young literate females to males is the percentage of females to males ages 15-24 who can, with understanding, read and write a short, simple statement on their everyday life.
description/literacy_rate_adult_female_p: Adult literacy rate is the percentage of people ages 15 and above who can, with understanding, read and write a short, simple statement on their everyday life.
description/literacy_rate_adult_male_per: Adult literacy rate is the percentage of people ages 15 and above who can, with understanding, read and write a short, simple statement on their everyday life.
description/literacy_rate_adult_total_pe: Adult literacy rate is the percentage of people ages 15 and above who can, with understanding, read and write a short, simple statement on their everyday life.
description/literacy_rate_youth_female_p: Youth literacy rate is the percentage of people ages 15-24 who can, with understanding, read and write a short, simple statement on their everyday life.
description/literacy_rate_youth_male_per: Youth literacy rate is the percentage of people ages 15-24 who can, with understanding, read and write a short, simple statement on their everyday life.
description/literacy_rate_youth_total_pe: Youth literacy rate is the percentage of people ages 15-24 who can, with understanding, read and write a short, simple statement on their everyday life.
description/children_out_of_school_prima: Break in series between 1997 and 1998 due to change from International Standard Classification of Education (ISCED76) to ISCED97. Recent data are provisional. Children out of school are the number of primary-school-age children not enrolled in primary or secondary school.

Break in series between 1997 and 1998 due to change from International Standard Classification of Education (ISCED76) to ISCED97. Recent data are provisional. Children out of school are the number of primary-school-age children not enrolled in primary or secondary school.

Break in series between 1997 and 1998 due to change from International Standard Classification of Education (ISCED76) to ISCED97. Recent data are provisional. Children out of school are the number of primary-school-age children not enrolled in primary or secondary school.
description/primary_completion_rate_tota: Primary completion rate is the percentage of students completing the last year of primary school. It is calculated by taking the total number of students in the last grade of primary school, minus the number of repeaters in that grade, divided by the total number of children of official graduation age.
description/primary_school_completion_pe: Completion rate in primary schooling for boys (percent of boys).
Completion rate in primary schooling for girls (percent of girls).
description/expenditure_per_student_prim: Break in series between 1997 and 1998 due to change from International Standard Classification of Education (ISCED76) to ISCED97. Recent data are provisional. Public expenditure per student is the public current spending on education divided by the total number of students by level, as a percentage of GDP per person. Public expenditure (current and capital) includes government spending on educational institutions (both public and private), education administration as well as subsidies for private entities (students/households and other privates entities).
description/expenditure_per_student_seco: Break in series between 1997 and 1998 due to change from International Standard Classification of Education (ISCED76) to ISCED97. Recent data are provisional. Public expenditure per student is the public current spending on education divided by the total number of students by level, as a percentage of GDP per person. Public expenditure (current and capital) includes government spending on educational institutions (both public and private), education administration as well as subsidies for private entities (students/households and other privates entities).
description/expenditure_per_student_tert: Break in series between 1997 and 1998 due to change from International Standard Classification of Education (ISCED76) to ISCED97. Recent data are provisional. Public expenditure per student is the public current spending on education divided by the total number of students by level, as a percentage of GDP per person. Public expenditure (current and capital) includes government spending on educational institutions (both public and private), education administration as well as subsidies for private entities (students/households and other privates entities).
description/mean_years_in_school_women_2: The average number of years of school attended by all people in the age and gender group specified, including primary, secondary and tertiary education.
description/mean_years_in_school_men_25_: The average number of years of school attended by all people in the age and gender group specified, including primary, secondary and tertiary education.
description/mean_years_in_school_women_2: The average number of years of school attended by all people in the age and gender group specified, including primary, secondary and tertiary education.
description/mean_years_in_school_men_25_: The average number of years of school attended by all people in the age and gender group specified, including primary, secondary and tertiary education.
description/mean_years_in_school_women_o: The average number of years of school attended by all people in the age and gender group specified, including primary, secondary and tertiary education.
description/mean_years_in_school_women_p: The ratio of female to male number of years in school, among 25- to 34-year-olds, including primary, secondary and tertiary education.
description/energy_use_total: Energy use refers to use of primary energy before transformation to other end-use fuels, which is equal to indigenous production plus imports and stock changes, minus exports and fuels supplied to ships and aircraft engaged in international transport, counted in tonnes of oil equivalent (toe).
description/energy_use_per_person: Energy use refers to use of primary energy before transformation to other end-use fuels, which is equal to indigenous production plus imports and stock changes, minus exports and fuels supplied to ships and aircraft engaged in international transport, counted in tonnes of oil equivalent (toe).
description/energy_production_total: Energy production refers to forms of primary energy--petroleum (crude oil, natural gas liquids, and oil from nonconventional sources), natural gas, solid fuels (coal, lignite, and other derived fuels), and combustible renewables and waste--and primary electricity, all converted into tonnes of oil equivalents, counted in tonnes of oil equivalent (toe).
description/energy_production_per_person: Energy production refers to forms of primary energy--petroleum (crude oil, natural gas liquids, and oil from nonconventional sources), natural gas, solid fuels (coal, lignite, and other derived fuels), and combustible renewables and waste--and primary electricity, all converted into tonnes of oil equivalents, calculated by dividing with the population of each country during the given year, counted in tonnes of oil equivalent (toe).
description/pump_price_for_gasoline_us_p: Fuel prices refer to the pump prices of the most widely sold grade of gasoline.
description/coal_consumption_total: Total amount of coal consumption (tonnes oil equivalent)
description/coal_consumption_per_cap: Coal consumption per person (tonnes oil equivalent)
description/electricity_use_per_person: The amount of electricity consumed per person during the given year, counted in kilowatt-hours (kWh).
description/electricity_use_total: The total amount of electricity consumed during the given year, counted in kilowatt-hours (kWh).
description/residential_electricity_use_: The amount of residential electricity consumed per person during the given year, counted in kilowatt-hours (kWh).
The total amount of residential electricity consumed during the given year, counted in kilowatt-hours (kWh).
description/hydro_power_generation_total: The amount of hydro power generated during the given year, counted in tonnes of oil equivalent (toe).
description/hydro_power_generation_per_p: The amount of hydro power generated per person during the given year, counted in tonnes of oil equivalent (toe).
description/nuclear_power_generation_tot: The amount of electricity produced by nuclear power plants in a given year, counted in tonnes of oil equivalent (toe).
description/nuclear_power_generation_per: The amount of electricity produced by nuclear power plants per person in a given year, counted in tonnes of oil equivalent (toe).
description/natural_gas_production_per_p: Natural gas production per person (tonnes oil equivalent)
description/natural_gas_proven_reserves_: Natural gas proven reserves per person (tonnes oil equivalent)
description/natural_gas_proved_reserves_: Proven reserves of natural gas (tonnes oil equivalent)
description/oil_production_per_person: Crude oil production per person (tonnes oil equivalent)
description/oil_production_total: Total amount of crude oil production (tonnes oil equivalent)
description/oil_proven_reserves_per_pers: Oil proven reserves per person (tonnes oil equivalent)
description/oil_proved_reserves_total: Proven reserves of oil (tonnes oil equivalent)
description/oil_consumption_total: Total amount of crude oil consumption (tonnes oil equivalent)
description/oil_consumption_per_cap: Oil Consumption per capita (tonnes per year per person)
description/drought_deaths_annual_number: Number of people killed in drought during the given year.
description/earthquake_deaths_annual_num: Number of people killed in earthquake during the given year.
description/epidemic_deaths_annual_numbe: Number of people killed in epidemic during the given year.
description/extreme_temperature_deaths_a: Number of people killed in extreme temperature during the given year.
description/flood_deaths_annual_number: Number of people killed in flood during the given year.
description/storm_deaths_annual_number: Number of people killed in storm during the given year.
description/tsunami_deaths_annual_number: Number of people killed in tsunami during the given year.
description/plane_crash_deaths_annual_nu: Number of people killed in air accidents during the given year.
description/drought_affected_annual_numb: Total number of people getting affected, injured or killed in drought during the given year.
description/earthquake_affected_annual_n: Total number of people getting affected, injured or killed in earthquake during the given year.
description/epidemic_affected_annual_num: Total number of people getting affected, injured or killed in epidemic during the given year.
description/extreme_temperature_affected: Total number of people getting affected, injured or killed in extreme temperature during the given year.
description/flood_affected_annual_number: Total number of people getting affected, injured or killed in flood during the given year.
description/storm_affected_annual_number: Total number of people getting affected, injured or killed in storm during the given year.
description/tsunami_affected_annual_numb: Total number of people getting affected, injured or killed in tsunami during the given year.
description/plane_crash_affected_annual_: Total number of people getting affected, injured or killed in air accidents during the given year.
description/co2_intensity_of_economic_ou: Measures the amount of CO2 (kg) emitted for every dollar of GDP (constant purchasing power parity-adjusted) produced.
description/cumulative_co2_emissions_ton: Total CO2 emissions from fossil fuel for the period between 1751 and the relevant year in metric tonnes.
description/sulfur_emissions_per_person_: Sulfur emissions per person. Associated with acid rain. (Kilograms of sulfur per person and year).
description/yearly_co2_emissions_tonnes: Total carbon dioxide emissions from the burning of fossil fuels during the given year (1000 metric tonnes of CO2).
description/total_sulfur_emission_kiloto: Total sulfur emissions per year. Associated with acid rain. 1000 tonnes of sulfur per year.
description/forest_land_total_area_ha: Total area of land (hectares) which is spanning more than 0.5 hectares with trees higher than 5 meters and a canopy cover of more than 10%, or trees able to reach these thresholds in situ. It does not include land that is predominantly under agricultural or urban land use.
description/primary_forest_area_ha: Total area of forest land (hectares) with native species, where there are no clearly visible indications of human activities and the ecological processes are not significantly disturbed.
description/planted_forest_area_ha: Total area of forest land (hectares) established through planting or seeding, basically of introduced species and in some cases native species.
description/wood_removal_cubic_meters: The wood removed (volume of round wood over bark) for production of goods and services other than energy production (wood fuel), excluding felled trees left in the forest.
description/forest_coverage_percent: Percentage of total land area that has been covered with forest during the given year; excluding other wooded land, which is spanning more than 0.5 hectares, with trees higher than 5 meters and a canopy cover of 5-10 percent, or trees able to reach these thresholds in situ, or with a combined cover of shrubs, bushes and trees above 10 percent.
description/biomass_stock_in_forest_tons: Biomass stock refers to organic material both above-ground and below-ground, and both living and dead, e.g., trees, crops, grasses, tree litter, roots etc.; including the pool definition for above- and below-ground biomass in forest; other wooded land not included.
description/privately_owned_forest_land_: Percentage of forest land that is owned by individuals, families, private co-operatives, corporations, industries, private religious and educational institutions, pension or investment funds, and other private institutions.
description/privately_owned_other_wooded: Percentage of other wooded land that is owned by individuals, families, private co-operatives, corporations, industries, private religious and educational institutions, pension or investment funds, and other private institutions.
description/forest_products_removal_tota: Total annual value of forest products in current USD, including both wood and non-wood removal during that year.
description/forest_products_removal_per_: Total annual value of forest products in current USD per hectares, including both wood and non-wood removal during that year.
description/agricultural_land_percent_of: Agricultural land refers to the share of land area that is arable, under permanent crops, and under permanent pastures. Includes land under temporary crops, temporary meadows for mowing or for pasture, land under market or kitchen gardens, and land temporarily fallow. It excludes land under trees grown for wood or timber.
description/forest_area_sq_km: Forest area is land under natural or planted stands of trees, whether productive or not.
description/surface_area_sq_km: A country's total area, including areas under inland bodies of water and some coastal waterways.
description/renewable_water_cu_meters_pe: Actual quantity of renewable water resources per person per year in cubic meters. Renewable water resources refer to the average annual flow of rivers and recharge of groundwater generated from perecipitation, which corresponds to the maximum theoretical yearly amount of water actually available for a country at a given moment. and the resources shared with neighboring countries (geopolitical constraints) have been taken into account.
description/internal_renewable_water_cu_: Quantity of internal renewable water resources per person per year in cubic meters. Internal Renewable Water Resources (IRWR): Long-term average annual flow of rivers and recharge of aquifers generated from endogenous precipitation. Double counting of surface water and groundwater resources is avoided by deducting the overlap from the sum of the surface water and groundwater resources.
description/water_withdrawal_cu_meters_p: Total annual quantity of freshwater withdrawn per person per year, counted in cubic meters. It includes renewable freshwater resources as well as potential over-abstraction of renewable groundwater or withdrawal of fossil groundwater and eventual use of desalinated water or treated wastewater. It does not include other categories of water use, such as for cooling of power plants, mining, recreation, navigation, fisheries, etc., which are sectors that are characterized by a very low net consumption rate.
description/municipal_water_withdrawal_c: Volume of water withdrawal per person per year directly used by the population, counted in cubic meters. It includes renewable freshwater resources as well as potential over-abstraction of renewable groundwater or withdrawal of fossil groundwater and the potential use of desalinated water or treated wastewater. It is usually computed as the total water withdrawn by the public distribution network. It can include that part of the industries, which is connected to the municipal network. The ratio between the net consumption and the water withdrawn can vary from 5 to 15% in urban areas and from 10 to 50% in rural areas.
description/agricultural_water_withdrawa: Percentage of the total water withdrawal used in agriculture, including renewable freshwater resources as well as potential over-abstraction of renewable groundwater or withdrawal of fossil groundwater, use of agricultural drainage water, desalinated water and treated wastewater. It also includes water withdrawn for irrigation purposes and for livestock watering, although depending on the country this last category sometimes is included in municipal water withdrawal. As far as the water withdrawn for irrigation is concerned, the value far exceeds the consumptive use of irrigation because of water lost in its distribution from its source to the crops.
description/industrial_water_withdrawal_: Percentage of the total water withdrawal used in industry, including renewable water resources as well as potential over-abstraction of renewable groundwater or withdrawal of fossil groundwater and potential use of desalinated water or treated wastewater. Usually, this sector refers to self-supplied industries not connected to any distribution network. The ratio between net consumption and withdrawal is estimated at less than 5%.
description/municipal_water_withdrawal_p: Percentage of the total water withdrawal directly used by the population, including renewable freshwater resources as well as potential over-abstraction of renewable groundwater or withdrawal of fossil groundwater and the potential use of desalinated water or treated wastewater. It is usually computed as the total water withdrawn by the public distribution network. It can include that part of the industries, which is connected to the municipal network. The ratio between the net consumption and the water withdrawn can vary from 5 to 15% in urban areas and from 10 to 50% in rural areas.
description/desalinated_water_produced_b: Total quantity of the production of freshwater by desalination of brackish or saltwater (mostly for domestic purposes) during the given year, counted in billion cubic meters.
description/total_water_withdrawal_billi: Annual quantity of freshwater withdrawn for agricultural, industrial and municipal purposes, counted in billion cubic meters. It includes renewable freshwater resources as well as potential over-abstraction of renewable groundwater or withdrawal of fossil groundwater and eventual use of desalinated water or treated wastewater. It does not include other categories of water use, such as for cooling of power plants, mining, recreation, navigation, fisheries, etc., which are sectors that are characterized by a very low net consumption rate.

description/underweight_children: Percent of children under five who are more than two standard deviations below average weight for age.
description/all_causes_deaths_in_newborn: All causes deaths in newborn (per 1,000 births)
description/birth_asphyxia_deaths_in_new: Birth asphyxia deaths in newborn (per 1,000 births)

description/birth_asphyxia_deaths_in_new: Birth asphyxia deaths in newborn (total deaths)
description/all_causes_deaths_in_childre: All causes deaths in children 1-59 months (per 1,000 births)
description/diarrhoeal_deaths_in_childre: Diarrhoeal deaths in children 1-59 months (per 1,000 births)
description/hiv_deaths_in_children_1_59_: HIV deaths in children 1-59 months (per 1,000 births)
description/injury_deaths_in_children_1_: Injury deaths in children 1-59 months (per 1,000 births)

description/meningitis_deaths_in_childre: Meningitis deaths in children 1-59 months (per 1,000 births)

description/other_infections_deaths_in_c: Other infections deaths in children 1-59 months (per 1,000 births)
description/all_causes_deaths_in_childre: All causes deaths in children 1-59 months (total deaths)
description/diarrhoeal_deaths_in_childre: Diarrhoeal deaths in children 1-59 months (total deaths)

description/injury_deaths_in_children_1_: Injury deaths in children 1-59 months (total deaths)

description/ncd_deaths_in_children_1_59_: NCD deaths in children 1-59 months (total deaths)

description/other_infections_deaths_in_c: Other infections deaths in children 1-59 months (total deaths)

description/cervical_cancer_new_cases_pe: Number of new cases of cervical cancer in 100,000 female residents during the certain year. This rate is calculated as if each country has the same age composition as the world population.
description/colonandrectum_cancer_new_ca: Number of new cases of colon&rectum cancer in 100,000 female residents during the certain year. This rate is calculated as if each country has the same age composition as the world population.
description/liver_cancer_new_cases_per_1: Number of new cases of liver cancer in 100,000 female residents during the certain year. This rate is calculated as if each country has the same age composition as the world population.
description/lung_cancer_new_cases_per_10: Number of new cases of lung cancer in 100,000 female residents during the certain year. This rate is calculated as if each country has the same age composition as the world population.
description/stomach_cancer_new_cases_per: Number of new cases of stomach cancer in 100,000 female residents during the certain year. This rate is calculated as if each country has the same age composition as the world population.

description/cervical_cancer_number_of_ne: Total number of new female cases of cervical cancer during the certain year.
description/colonandrectum_cancer_number: Total number of new female cases of colon&rectum cancer during the certain year.
description/liver_cancer_number_of_new_f: Total number of new female cases of liver cancer during the certain year.

description/cervical_cancer_deaths_per_1: Number of deaths due to cervical cancer in 100,000 female residents during the certain year. This rate is calculated as if each country has the same age composition as the world population.
description/colonandrectum_cancer_deaths: Number of deaths due to colon&rectum cancer in 100,000 female residents during the certain year. This rate is calculated as if each country has the same age composition as the world population.
description/liver_cancer_deaths_per_1000: Number of deaths due to liver cancer in 100,000 female residents during the certain year. This rate is calculated as if each country has the same age composition as the world population.
description/lung_cancer_deaths_per_10000: Number of deaths due to lung cancer in 100,000 female residents during the certain year. This rate is calculated as if each country has the same age composition as the world population.
description/stomach_cancer_deaths_per_10: Number of deaths due to stomach cancer in 100,000 female residents during the certain year. This rate is calculated as if each country has the same age composition as the world population.
description/breast_cancer_number_of_fema: Total number of female deaths due to breast cancer during the certain year.
description/cervical_cancer_number_of_fe: Total number of female deaths due to cervical cancer during the certain year.
description/colonandrectum_cancer_number: Total number of female deaths due to colon&rectum cancer during the certain year.
description/liver_cancer_number_of_femal: Total number of female deaths due to liver cancer during the certain year.
description/lung_cancer_number_of_female: Total number of female deaths due to lung cancer during the certain year.
description/stomach_cancer_number_of_fem: Total number of female deaths due to stomach cancer during the certain year.
description/colonandrectum_cancer_new_ca: Number of new cases of colon&rectum cancer in 100,000 male residents during the certain year. This rate is calculated as if each country has the same age composition as the world population.
description/liver_cancer_new_cases_per_1: Number of new cases of liver cancer in 100,000 male residents during the certain year. This rate is calculated as if each country has the same age composition as the world population.
description/lung_cancer_new_cases_per_10: Number of new cases of lung cancer in 100,000 male residents during the certain year. This rate is calculated as if each country has the same age composition as the world population.
description/prostate_cancer_new_cases_pe: Number of new cases of prostate cancer in 100,000 male residents during the certain year. This rate is calculated as if each country has the same age composition as the world population.
description/stomach_cancer_new_cases_per: Number of new cases of stomach cancer in 100,000 male residents during the certain year. This rate is calculated as if each country has the same age composition as the world population.
description/colonandrectum_cancer_number: Total number of new male cases of colon&rectum cancer during the certain year.
description/liver_cancer_number_of_new_m: Total number of new male cases of liver cancer during the certain year.
description/lung_cancer_number_of_new_ma: Total number of new male cases of lung cancer during the certain year.
description/prostate_cancer_number_of_ne: Total number of new male cases of prostate cancer during the certain year.
description/stomach_cancer_number_of_new: Total number of new male cases of stomach cancer during the certain year.
description/colonandrectum_cancer_deaths: Number of deaths due to colon&rectum cancer in 100,000 male residents during the certain year. This rate is calculated as if each country has the same age composition as the world population.
description/liver_cancer_deaths_per_1000: Number of deaths due to liver cancer in 100,000 male residents during the certain year. This rate is calculated as if each country has the same age composition as the world population.
description/lung_cancer_deaths_per_10000: Number of deaths due to lung cancer in 100,000 male residents during the certain year. This rate is calculated as if each country has the same age composition as the world population.

description/stomach_cancer_deaths_per_10: Number of deaths due to stomach cancer in 100,000 male residents during the certain year. This rate is calculated as if each country has the same age composition as the world population.
description/colonandrectum_cancer_number: Total number of male deaths due to colon&rectum cancer during the certain year.
description/liver_cancer_number_of_male_: Total number of male deaths due to liver cancer during the certain year.
