description/total_health_spending_percen: The sum of public and private health expenditure as a percentage of GDP.
description/government_share_of_total_he: Percentage of total health expenditure that has been paid by government entities, for example Ministry of Health and social security agencies.
description/private_share_of_total_healt: Percentage of total health expenditure that has been paid by private entities, for example commercial insurance and out-of-pocket payments.
description/out_of_pocket_share_of_total: Proportion of total health expenditures that has been paid directly out-of-pocket by individuals.
description/government_health_spending_o: Proportion of total government expenditure that has been expended in health.
description/total_health_spending_per_pe: The average health expenditure per person, expressed in international dollars using PPP (Purchasing Power Parity).
description/government_health_spending_p: The average health expenditure per person that has been paid by government entities, expressed in international dollars using PPP (Purchasing Power Parity).
description/total_health_spending_per_pe: The average health expenditure per person, expressed in US dollars using the average exchange rate.
description/government_health_spending_p: The average health expenditure per person that has been paid by government entities during the given year, expressed in US dollars using the average exchange rate.
description/medical_doctors_per_1000_peo: Medical Doctors (physicians) working in any medical field per 1,000 people.
description/people_living_with_hiv_numbe: The total number of persons in all ages that are estimated to be infected by HIV, including those without symptoms, those sick from AIDS and those healthy due to treatment of the HIV infection
description/adults_with_hiv_percent_age_: The estimated percentage of adults aged 15 to 49 years that are infected by HIV, including those without symptoms, those sick from AIDS and those healthy due to treatment of the HIV infection
description/newly_hiv_infected_number_al: The total number of persons in all ages that are estimated to be newly infected with HIV during the given year.
description/newly_hiv_infected_percent_a: The estimated percentage of adults aged 15 to 49 years that are newly infected with HIV during the given year.
description/annual_hiv_deaths_number_all: The total number of people that were estimated as died from HIV/AIDS during the given year.
description/art_coverage_percent_cd4_l_3: For people who have been diagnosed as CD4 count < 350 / mm3, how many (%) have access to ART treatment, estimation.
description/malaria_cases_per_100000_rep: Number of malaria cases in every 100,000 residents during the given year.
description/malaria_deaths_per_100000_re: Number of malaria deaths in every 100,000 residents during the given year.
description/malaria_number_of_cases_repo: Total number of malaria cases reported during the given year.
description/malaria_number_of_deaths_rep: Total number of malaria deaths reported during the given year.
description/births_attended_by_skilled_h: The percentage of deliveries attended by personnel (including doctors, nurses and midwives) trained to give the necessary supervision, care, and advice to women during pregnancy, labor, and the postpartum period; to conduct deliveries on their own; and to care for newborns.
description/contraceptive_use_percent_of: Contraceptive prevalence rate is the percentage of women who are practicing, or whose sexual partners are practicing, any form of contraception. It is usually measured for married women ages 15-49 only.
description/maternal_mortality_ratio_per: The number of maternal deaths divided by the number of live births in a given year, multiplied by 100,000. Maternal death is defined as the death of a women while pregnant or within the 42 days after termination of that pregnancy, regardless of the length and site of the pregnancy, from a cause related to or aggravated by the pregnancy.
description/maternal_deaths_total_number: Total number of maternal deaths in a given year. Maternal death is defined as the death of a women while pregnant or within the 42 days after termination of that pregnancy, regardless of the length and site of the pregnancy, from a cause related to or aggravated by the pregnancy.
description/maternal_deaths_lifetime_ris: The chance of dying during pregnancy or within the 42 days after termination of that pregnancy in a lifetime, regardless of the length and site of the pregnancy, from a cause related to or aggravated by the pregnancy, the counting unit is per 1,000.
description/stillbirths_per_1000_births: The number of stillbirths per 1000 births (live births plus stillbirths).
description/suicide_per_100000_people: Mortality due to self-inflicted injury, per 100 000 standard population, age adjusted. This rate is calculated as if all countries had the same age composition of the population.
description/malnutrition_weight_for_age_: The percentage of children under age 5 whose weight for age is more than two standard deviations below the median for the 2006 WHO international reference population.
description/sugar_per_person_g_per_day: The quantity of food consumption of sugar and sweeteners (grams per person and day). NOTE: data for 2004 are based on a rough extrapolation by Gapminder.
description/food_supply_kilocalories_per: Calories measures the energy content of the food. The required intake varies, but it is normally in the range of 1500-3000 kilocalories per day. One banana contains approximatly 100 kilocalories.
description/alcohol_consumption_per_adul: Recorded plus estimated alcohol consumption, average adult (15+) per capita consumption in litres
description/smoking_adults_percent_of_po: Percentage of both men and women (over age 15) that smoke. Note: only 2005 tobacco data is provided by WHOSIS. In order to compare with 2002 lung cancer data, 2005 tobacco data was copied into 2002, based on the assumption that people's habit of smoking won't significantly change during 3 years.
description/smoking_women_percent_of_wom: Percentage of women (over age 15) that smoke. Note: only 2005 tobacco data is provided by WHOSIS. In order to compare with 2002 lung cancer data, 2005 tobacco data was copied into 2002, based on the assumption that people's habit of smoking won't significantly change during 3 years.
description/smoking_men_percent_of_men_o: Percentage of men (over age 15) that smoke. Note: only 2005 tobacco data is provided by WHOSIS. In order to compare with 2002 lung cancer data, 2005 tobacco data was copied into 2002, based on the assumption that people's habit of smoking won't significantly change during 3 years.
description/body_mass_index_bmi_men_kgpe: The mean BMI (Body Mass Index) of the male population, counted in kilogram per square meter; this mean is calculated as if each country has the same age composition as the world population.
description/body_mass_index_bmi_women_kg: The mean BMI (Body Mass Index) of the female population, counted in kilogram per square meter; this mean is calculated as if each country has the same age composition as the world population.
description/blood_pressure_sbp_men_mmhg: The mean SBP (Systolic Blood Pressure) of the male population, counted in mm-Hg; this mean is calculated as if each country has the same age composition as the world population.
description/blood_pressure_sbp_women_mmh: The mean SBP (Systolic Blood Pressure) of the female population, counted in mm-Hg; this mean is calculated as if each country has the same age composition as the world population.
description/cholesterol_fat_in_blood_men: The mean TC (Total Cholesterol) of the male population, counted in mmol per L; this mean is calculated as if each country has the same age composition as the world population.
description/cholesterol_fat_in_blood_wom: The mean TC (Total Cholesterol) of the female population, counted in mmol per L; this mean is calculated as if each country has the same age composition as the world population.
description/infectious_tb_new_cases_per_: Estimated number of new TB cases (infectious) among 100,000 residents during the given year.
Reported number of new TB cases (infectious) among 100,000 residents during the given year.
description/infectious_tb_number_of_new_: Estimated number of new TB cases (infectious) during the given year.
Reported number of new TB cases (infectious) during the given year.
description/infectious_tb_detection_rate: The proportion of estimated new smear-positive cases of TB detected (diagnosed and then notified to WHO) by health facilities in the country during the given year.

The proportion of estimated new smear-positive cases of TB detected (diagnosed and then notified to WHO) during the given year by DOTS programme, which is national TB programmes in finding and diagnosing people with TB.
description/infectious_tb_treatment_dots: Percentage of all patients with infectious TB detected by DOTS programme that have finished the treatment during the given year.
description/tb_programme_dots_population: Percentage of total population that has been covered by DOTS programme, which is national TB programmes in finding and diagnosing people with TB.
description/all_forms_of_tb_new_cases_pe: Estimated number of new TB cases (all forms) among 100,000 residents during the given year.
description/all_forms_of_tb_existing_cas: Estimated number of existing TB cases (all forms) among 100,000 residents during the given year.
description/all_forms_of_tb_deaths_per_1: Estimated number of deaths caused by TB (all forms) among 100,000 residents during the given year.
description/all_forms_of_tb_new_cases_pe: Reported number of new and relapsed TB cases (all forms) among 100,000 residents during the given year.
description/all_forms_of_tb_number_of_ne: Estimated number of new TB cases (all forms) during the given year.
description/all_forms_of_tb_number_of_ex: Estimated number of existing TB cases (all forms) during the given year.
description/all_forms_of_tb_number_of_de: Estimated number of deaths caused by TB (all forms) during the given year.
description/all_forms_of_tb_number_of_ne: Reported number of new and relapsed TB cases (all forms) during the given year.
description/all_forms_of_tb_detection_ra: The proportion of estimated new cases of TB detected (diagnosed and then notified to WHO) by health facilities in the country during the given year.

The proportion of estimated new cases of TB detected (diagnosed and then notified to WHO) during the given year by DOTS programme, which is national TB programmes in finding and diagnosing people with TB.
description/tb_with_hivplus_new_cases_pe: Estimated number of new TB cases (with HIV+) among 100,000 residents during the given year.
description/tb_with_hivplus_existing_cas: Estimated number of existing TB cases (with HIV+) among 100,000 residents during the given year.
description/tb_with_hivplus_deaths_per_1: Estimated number of deaths caused by TB (with HIV+) among 100,000 residents during the given year.
description/tb_with_hivplus_number_of_ne: Estimated number of new TB cases (with HIV+) during the given year.
description/tb_with_hivplus_number_of_ex: Estimated number of existing TB cases (with HIV+) during the given year.
description/tb_with_hivplus_number_of_de: Estimated number of deaths caused by TB (with HIV+) during the given year.
description/bad_teeth_per_child_12_yr: The weighted average of the number of Decayed, Missing or Filled teeth among the 12 years old in a country (DMFT). It is meant to reflect the prevalence of caries in a population.
description/dtp3_immunized_percent_of_on: Percentage of 1 year old children who have received 3 doses of combined diphtheria, tetanus toxoid and pertussis vaccine during the year.
description/hepb3_immunized_percent_of_o: Percentage of 1 year old children who have received 3 doses of hepatitis B3 vaccine during the year.
description/hib3_immunized_percent_of_on: Percentage of 1 year old children who have received 3 doses of Haemophilus influenzae type B vaccine during the year.
description/mcv_immunized_percent_of_one: Percentage of 1 year old children who have received at least one dose of measles-containing vaccine in a given year. (Some countries for children below 2 years, depending on their policies.)
description/pab_immunized_percent_of_new: Percentage of neonates in a given year that can be considered as having been protected against tetanus as a result of maternal immunization.
description/broadband_subscribers: Broadband subscribers are the total number of broadband subscribers with a digital subscriber line, cable modem, or other high-speed technologies, although definitions may vary from country to country.
description/broadband_subscribers_per_10: Broadband subscribers are the total number of broadband subscribers with a digital subscriber line, cable modem, or other high-speed technologies, although definitions may vary from country to country.
description/cell_phones_total: The number of subscribers to a service providing access to the telephone network using cellular technology.
description/cell_phones_per_100_people: The number of subscribers per 100 people to a service providing access to the telephone network using cellular technology.
description/fixed_line_and_mobile_phone_: Fixes lines connect a customer's equipment to the public switched telephone network. Mobile phone subscribers refer to users of portable telephones subscribing to the telephone network using cellular technology.
description/internet_users_total_number: Internet users are people with access to the worldwide network.
description/internet_users_per_100_peopl: Internet users are people with access to the worldwide network.
description/improved_sanitation_overall_: The percentage of the total population with access to facilities that hygienically separate human excreta from human contact. Improved facilities include flush/pour flush toilets or latrines connected to a sewer, -septic tank, or -pit, ventilated improved pit latrines, pit latrines with a slab or platform of any material which covers the pit entirely, except for the drop hole and composting toilets/latrines. Unimproved facilities include public or shared facilities of an otherwise acceptable type, flush/pour-flush toilets or latrines which discharge directly into an open sewer or ditch, pit latrines without a slab, bucket latrines, hanging toilets or latrines which directly discharge in water bodies or in the open and the practice of open defecation in the bush, field or bodies or water.
description/improved_sanitation_urban_ac: The percentage of the urban population with access to facilities that hygienically separate human excreta from human contact. Improved facilities include flush/pour flush toilets or latrines connected to a sewer, -septic tank, or -pit, ventilated improved pit latrines, pit latrines with a slab or platform of any material which covers the pit entirely, except for the drop hole and composting toilets/latrines. Unimproved facilities include public or shared facilities of an otherwise acceptable type, flush/pour-flush toilets or latrines which discharge directly into an open sewer or ditch, pit latrines without a slab, bucket latrines, hanging toilets or latrines which directly discharge in water bodies or in the open and the practice of open defecation in the bush, field or bodies or water.
description/improved_sanitation_rural_ac: The percentage of the rural population with access to facilities that hygienically separate human excreta from human contact. Improved facilities include flush/pour flush toilets or latrines connected to a sewer, -septic tank, or -pit, ventilated improved pit latrines, pit latrines with a slab or platform of any material which covers the pit entirely, except for the drop hole and composting toilets/latrines. Unimproved facilities include public or shared facilities of an otherwise acceptable type, flush/pour-flush toilets or latrines which discharge directly into an open sewer or ditch, pit latrines without a slab, bucket latrines, hanging toilets or latrines which directly discharge in water bodies or in the open and the practice of open defecation in the bush, field or bodies or water.
description/improved_water_source_overal: The percentage of the total population who use any of the following types of water supply for drinking: piped water into dwelling, plot or yard; public tap/standpipe; borehole/tube well; protected dug well; protected spring; rainwater collection and bottled water (if a secondary available source is also improved). It does not include unprotected well, unprotected spring, water provided by carts with small tanks/drums, tanker truck-provided water and bottled water (if secondary source is not an improved source) or surface water taken directly from rivers, ponds, streams, lakes, dams, or irrigation channels.
description/improved_water_source_urban_: The percentage of the urban population who use any of the following types of water supply for drinking: piped water into dwelling, plot or yard; public tap/standpipe; borehole/tube well; protected dug well; protected spring; rainwater collection and bottled water (if a secondary available source is also improved). It does not include unprotected well, unprotected spring, water provided by carts with small tanks/drums, tanker truck-provided water and bottled water (if secondary source is not an improved source) or surface water taken directly from rivers, ponds, streams, lakes, dams, or irrigation channels.
description/improved_water_source_rural_: The percentage of the rural population who use any of the following types of water supply for drinking: piped water into dwelling, plot or yard; public tap/standpipe; borehole/tube well; protected dug well; protected spring; rainwater collection and bottled water (if a secondary available source is also improved). It does not include unprotected well, unprotected spring, water provided by carts with small tanks/drums, tanker truck-provided water and bottled water (if secondary source is not an improved source) or surface water taken directly from rivers, ponds, streams, lakes, dams, or irrigation channels.
description/population_aged_0_4_years_bo: Number of both sexes aged 0-4 years divided by total population
description/population_aged_5_9_years_bo: Number of both sexes aged 5-9 years divided by total population
description/population_aged_10_14_years_: Number of both sexes aged 10-14 years divided by total population
description/population_aged_15_19_years_: Number of both sexes aged 15-19 years divided by total population
description/population_aged_20_39_years_: Number of both sexes aged 20-39 years divided by total population
description/population_aged_40_59_years_: Number of both sexes aged 40-59 years divided by total population
description/population_aged_60plus_years: Number of both sexes aged above 60 years divided by total population
description/population_aged_0_4_years_to: Total number of people aged 0-4 years
description/population_aged_5_9_years_to: Total number of people aged 5-9 years
description/population_aged_10_14_years_: Total number of people aged 10-14 years
description/population_aged_15_19_years_: Total number of people aged 15-19 years
description/population_aged_20_39_years_: Total number of people aged 20-39 years
description/population_aged_40_59_years_: Total number of people aged 40-59 years
description/population_aged_60plus_years: Total number of people aged above 60 years
description/population_aged_0_4_years_fe: Number of women aged 0-4 years divided by total number of women
description/population_aged_5_9_years_fe: Number of women aged 5-9 years divided by total number of women
description/population_aged_10_14_years_: Number of women aged 10-14 years divided by total number of women
description/population_aged_15_19_years_: Number of women aged 15-19 years divided by total number of women
description/population_aged_20_39_years_: Number of women aged 20-39 years divided by total number of women
description/population_aged_40_59_years_: Number of women aged 40-59 years divided by total number of women
description/population_aged_60plus_years: Number of women aged above 60 years divided by total number of women
description/population_aged_0_4_years_ma: Number of men aged 0-4 years divided by total number of men
description/population_aged_5_9_years_ma: Number of men aged 5-9 years divided by total number of men
description/population_aged_10_14_years_: Number of men aged 10-14 years divided by total number of men
description/population_aged_15_19_years_: Number of men aged 15-19 years divided by total number of men
description/population_aged_20_39_years_: Number of men aged 20-39 years divided by total number of men
description/population_aged_40_59_years_: Number of men aged 40-59 years divided by total number of men
description/population_aged_60plus_years: Number of men aged above 60 years divided by total number of men
description/population_growth_annual_per: Annual de facto population growth rate.
description/crude_birth_rate_births_per_: The average number of births among 1,000 population during the given year (data after 2010 is based on the medium estimates from UN population division).
description/crude_death_rate_deaths_per_: The average number of deaths among 1,000 population during the given year (data after 2010 is based on the medium estimates from UN population division).
description/teen_fertility_rate_births_p: The number of births per 1,000 women ages 15-19.
description/new_births_total_number_esti: Total number of estimated new births during the given year, based on the crude birth rate data from UN Population Division and the population data from Gapminder Foundation.
description/sex_ratio_all_age_groups: Sex ratio (male divided by female, per 100) among total population of all age groups.
description/sex_ratio_0_14_years: Sex ratio (male divided by female, per 100) among population between 0 and 14 years old.
description/sex_ratio_15_24_years: Sex ratio (male divided by female, per 100) among population between 15 and 24 years old.
description/sex_ratio_15_49_years: Sex ratio (male divided by female, per 100) among population between 15 and 49 years old.
description/sex_ratio_above_50_years: Sex ratio (male divided by female, per 100) among population above 50 years old.
description/population_in_urban_agglomer: Population in urban agglomerations > 1 million (% of total population)
description/urban_population: Urban population is the midyear population of areas defined as urban in each country and reported to the United Nations.
description/urban_population_percent_of_: Urban population is the midyear population of areas defined as urban in each country and reported to the United Nations.
description/urban_population_growth_annu: Urban population is the midyear population of areas defined as urban in each country and reported to the United Nations.
description/children_and_elderly_per_100: The total dependency ratio is the ratio of the sum of the population aged 0-14 and 65+ to the population aged 15-64, multiplied by 100.
description/median_age_years: The median age of total population (years).
description/population_density_per_squar: Average number of people on each square km of the land in the given country.
description/age_at_1st_marriage_women: The mean age, in years, of first marriage for women. Women who never married are excluded. Cohabitation is excluded. The data are based on multple sources and definitions might vary.
description/murder_per_100000_people: Mortality due to interpersonal violence, per 100 000 standard population, age adjusted. This rate is calculated as if all countries had the same age composition of the population.
description/corruption_perception_index_: Transaprency International's score of perceptions of corruption. Higher values indicate less corruption.
description/democracy_score_use_as_color: Overall polity score from the Polity IV dataset, calculated by subtracting an autocracy score from a democracy score. It is a summary measure of a country's democratic and free nature. -10 is the lowest value, 10 the highest.
description/hdi_human_development_index: Human Development Index is an index used to rank countries by level of 'human development'. It contains three dimensions: health level, educational level and living standard.
description/agriculture_workers_percent_: Percentage of all labour force that works in agriculture sector.
description/industry_workers_percent_of_: Percentage of all labour force that works in industry sector.
description/service_workers_percent_of_l: Percentage of all labour force that works in service sector.
description/female_agriculture_workers_p: Percentage of all female labour force that works in agriculture sector.
description/female_industry_workers_perc: Percentage of all female labour force that works in industry sector.
description/female_service_workers_perce: Percentage of all female labour force that works in service sector.
description/male_agriculture_workers_per: Percentage of all male labour force that works in agriculture sector.
description/male_industry_workers_percen: Percentage of all male labour force that works in industry sector.
description/male_service_workers_percent: Percentage of all male labour force that works in service sector.
description/family_workers_percent_of_la: Percentage of all labour force that works as contributing family workers.
description/salaried_workers_percent_of_: Percentage of all labour force that earns a salary from working.
description/self_employed_percent_of_lab: Percentage of all labour force that works as self-employed workers.
description/female_family_workers_percen: Percentage of all female labour force that works as contributing family workers.
description/female_salaried_workers_perc: Percentage of all female labour force that earns a salary from working.
description/female_self_employed_percent: Percentage of all female labour force that works as self-employed workers.
description/male_family_workers_percent_: Percentage of all male labour force that works as contributing family workers.
description/male_salaried_workers_percen: Percentage of all male labour force that earns a salary from working.
description/male_self_employed_percent_o: Percentage of all male labour force that works as self-employed workers.
description/aged_15_24_employment_rate_p: Percentage of total population, age group 15-24, that has been employed during the given year.
description/aged_15plus_employment_rate_: Percentage of total population, age group 15+, that has been employed during the given year.
description/females_aged_15_24_employmen: Percentage of female population, age group 15-24, that has been employed during the given year.
description/females_aged_15plus_employme: Percentage of female population, age group 15+, that has been employed during the given year.
description/males_aged_15_24_employment_: Percentage of male population, age group 15-24, that has been employed during the given year.
description/males_aged_15plus_employment: Percentage of male population, age group 15+, that has been employed during the given year.
description/aged_15_64_labour_force_part: For age group 15-64, percentage of all labour to total population.
description/aged_25_54_labour_force_part: For age group 25-54, percentage of all labour to total population.
description/aged_15plus_labour_force_par: For age group 15+, percentage of all labour to total population.
description/aged_65plus_labour_force_par: For age group 65+, percentage of all labour to total population.
description/females_aged_15_64_labour_fo: For age group 15-64, percentage of female labour to total female population.
description/females_aged_25_54_labour_fo: For age group 25-54, percentage of female labour to total female population.
description/females_aged_15plus_labour_f: For age group 15+, percentage of female labour to total female population.
description/females_aged_65plus_labour_f: For age group 65+, percentage of female labour to total female population.
description/males_aged_15_64_labour_forc: For age group 15-64, percentage of male labour to total female population.
description/males_aged_25_54_labour_forc: For age group 25-54, percentage of male labour to total female population.
description/males_aged_15plus_labour_for: For age group 15+, percentage of male labour to total female population.
description/males_aged_65plus_labour_for: For age group 65+, percentage of male labour to total female population.
description/aged_15_24_unemployment_rate: Percentage of total population, age group 15-24, that has been registered as unemployed during the given year.
description/aged_25_54_unemployment_rate: Percentage of total population, age group 25-54, that has been registered as unemployed during the given year.
description/aged_15plus_unemployment_rat: Percentage of total population, age group above 15, that has been registered as unemployed during the given year.
description/aged_55plus_unemployment_rat: Percentage of total population, age group above 55, that has been registered as unemployed during the given year.
description/long_term_unemployment_rate_: Percentage of total population that has been registered as long-term unemployed during the given year.
description/females_aged_15_24_unemploym: Percentage of women, age group 15-24, that has been registered as unemployed during the given year.
description/females_aged_25_54_unemploym: Percentage of women, age group 25-54, that has been registered as unemployed during the given year.
description/females_aged_15plus_unemploy: Percentage of women, age group above 15, that has been registered as unemployed during the given year.
description/females_aged_55plus_unemploy: Percentage of women, age group above 55, that has been registered as unemployed during the given year.
description/female_long_term_unemploymen: Percentage of female population that has been registered as long-term unemployed during the given year.
description/males_aged_15_24_unemploymen: Percentage of men, age group 15-24, that has been registered as unemployed during the given year.
description/males_aged_25_54_unemploymen: Percentage of men, age group 25-54, that has been registered as unemployed during the given year.
description/males_aged_15plus_unemployme: Percentage of men, age group above 15, that has been registered as unemployed during the given year.
description/males_aged_55plus_unemployme: Percentage of men, age group above 55, that has been registered as unemployed during the given year.
description/male_long_term_unemployment_: Percentage of male population that has been registered as long-term unemployed during the given year.
description/under_five_mortality_from_cm: Death of children under five years of age per 1,000 live births. By The Inter-Agency Child Mortality Estimation Group (WHO, UNICEF, the United Nations Population Division, the World Bank, and independent experts) Sep 20 2011
description/under_five_mortality_from_ih: Death of children under five years of age per 1,000 live births. Estimates and projections from the Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation, 1970-2015.
description/old_version_of_income_per_pe: The version of Income per person used before 22 december 2008 (version 3). Gross Domestic Product per person by Purchasing Power Parities (in international dollars, fixed 1990 prices).
The version of Income per person used before 12 july 2010 (version 8). Gross Domestic Product per person by Purchasing Power Parities (in international dollars, fixed 2050 prices).
description/alternative_gdppercapita_ppp: Expressed in international $ (PPP) and adjusted for inflation (in 2000 prices). The indicator measures the same thing as 'income per person', but the source is different: Penn World Tables 6.2.
description/subsistence_incomes_per_pers: The same as 'Income per person (GDP/capita, inflation-adjusted $)' (version 9), but expressed in subsistence incomes per person ratehr than international $ per person. One subsistence income is equal to $1.25 per day (i.e. the lower poverty line), or $456.24 per year. Hence, we divided incomes epr person with 456.25.
description/alternative_poverty_percent_: National poverty rate is the percentage of the population living below the national poverty line. National estimates are based on population-weighted subgroup estimates from household surveys. Poverty lines vary between countries and so rates are not comparable.
description/data_quality_income_per_pers: Rates the quality for each observation of 'Income per person - revised'. The ratings are 0 (data quality not known yet) and 5 (very bad). You can use this 'indicator' as color together with income per person to highlight the roughest observations.
description/data_quality_life_expectancy: Rates the quality for each observation of 'Life expectancy at birth': (1) Yearly data; (2) Trend data; (3) Yearly guesstimates; (4) Trend guesstimates. You can use this 'indicator' together with 'Life expectancy at birth' to highlight the roughest observations.
description/data_quality_population: Rates the quality for each observation of 'Population, total'. The ratings are 1 (very good); 2 (good); 3 (fair); 4 (bad) and 5 (very bad). You can use this 'indicator' together with total population to highlight the roughest observations.
description/data_quality_children_per_wo: Rates the quality for each observation of 'Children per woman'. The ratings are 1 (very good); 2 (good); 3 (fair); 4 (bad) and 5 (very bad). You can use this 'indicator' together with 'Children per woman' to highlight the roughest observations.
description/data_method_maternal_mortali: Method used to estimate 'Maternal mortality': 1-Registration; 2-Reg. but ill defined; 3-Sisterhood surveys; 4-Mortality surveys, 5-Sample reg.; 6-Census based estim.; 7-Other data; 8-No data, model used
description/economic_growth_over_the_pas: Average annual growth in GDP per capita over the past 10 years, i.e. the data for 1980 concerns the average growth 1970-80. The data is based on the PWT 6.2.
description/how_far_to_the_north: The latitude of the country. A positive value means that the country is to the north of the equator, if it is negative it is to the south.
description/income_per_person_with_proje: The same as 'Income per person (GDP/capita, inflation-adjusted $)', with projections from IMF after 2007.
description/life_expectancy_at_birth_wit: The number of years a newborn child would live if current mortality patterns were to stay the same. Medium variant projections until 2050
description/children_per_woman_total_fer: Total fertility rate. The number of children that would be born to each woman with prevailing age-specific fertility rates. Data after 2010 is based on the medium estimates from UN population division.
description/total_population_with_projec: Total number of population of both sexes, data after 2010 is based on the medium estimates from UN population division.
description/female_population_with_proje: Total number of female population, data after 2010 is based on the medium estimates from UN population division.
description/male_population_with_project: Total number of male population, data after 2010 is based on the medium estimates from UN population division.
description/population_growth_annual_per: Annual change of population in percentage, data after 2010 is based on the medium estimates from UN population division.
description/year_categorization_1820_201: This 'indicator' simply duplicates the years between 1820 and 2010. Use it to color the bubbles (by selecting this indicator under 'color' in the top right-hand corner of the graph). This is useful when enabling 'trails' for several countries. Use this one for long time series.
description/year_categorization_1950: This 'indicator' simply duplicates the years between 1950 and 2008. Use it to color the bubbles (by selecting this indicator under 'color' in the top right-hand corner of the graph). This is useful when enabling 'trails' for several countries.
description/traffic_deaths_per_100000_pe: Traffic mortality per 100 000 standard population, age adjusted. This rate is calculated as if all countries had the same age composition of the population.
description/burns_deaths_per_100000_peop: Burns, age-adjusted mortality per 100 000 standard population. This rate is calculated as if all countries had the same age composition of the population.
description/drownings_per_100000_people: Drownings, age-adjusted mortality per 100 000 standard population. This rate is calculated as if all countries had the same age composition of the population.
description/falls_deaths_per_100000_peop: Falls, age-adjusted mortality per 100 000 standard population. This rate is calculated as if all countries had the same age composition of the population.
description/poisonings_deaths_per_100000: Unintentional poisonings, age-adjusted mortality per 100 000 standard population. This rate is calculated as if all countries had the same age composition of the population.
description/cars_trucks_and_buses_per_10: Registered four-wheel motor vehicles per 1,000 population. Cars, buses, and freight vehicles but  not  two-wheelers.
description/traffic_deaths_women_per_100: Mortality among women due to traffic injury, per 100,000 standard population, age adjusted, This rate is calculated as if all countries had the same age composition of the population.
description/traffic_deaths_men_per_10000: Mortality among men due to traffic injury, per 100,000 standard population, age adjusted. This rate is calculated as if all countries had the same age composition of the population.
description/suicide_women_per_100000_peo: Mortality due to self-inflicted injury among women, per 100,000 standard population, age adjusted. This rate is calculated as if all countries had the same age composition of the population.
description/suicide_men_per_100000_peopl: Mortality due to self-inflicted injury among men, per 100,000 standard population, age adjusted. This rate is calculated as if all countries had the same age composition of the population.
description/murdered_women_per_100000_pe: Mortality among women due to interpersonal violence, per 100,000 standard population, age adjusted. This rate is calculated as if all countries had the same age composition of the population.
description/murdered_men_per_100000_peop: Mortality among men due to interpersonal violence, per 100,000 standard population, age adjusted. This rate is calculated as if all countries had the same age composition of the population.
description/car_deaths_per_100000_people: Mortality among drivers and passengers of 4-wheel motorized vehicles, per 100,000. Age adjusted (calculated as if all countries had the same age structure).
description/motorcycle_deaths_per_100000: Mortality among drivers and passengers of 2-wheel motorized vehicles, per 100,000. Age adjusted (calculated as if all countries had the same age structure).
description/murdered_children_0_14_per_1: Mortality among  children aged 0-14 years due to interpersonal violence, per 100,000 standard population, age adjusted
description/murdered_15_29_per_100000_pe: Mortality among persons aged 15-29 due to interpersonal violence, per 100,000 standard population, age adjusted
description/murdered_30_44_per_100000_pe: Mortality among persons aged 30-44 due to interpersonal violence, per 100,000 standard population, age adjusted
description/murdered_45_59_per_100000_pe: Mortality among persons aged 45-59 due to interpersonal violence, per 100,000 standard population, age adjusted
description/murdered_60plus_per_100000_p: Mortality among persons aged 60+ due to interpersonal violence, per 100,000 standard population, age adjusted
description/suicide_age_0_14_per_100000_: Mortality due to self-inflicted injury among children aged 0-14 years, per 100,000 standard population, age adjusted
description/suicide_age_15_29_per_100000: Mortality due to self-inflicted injury among persons aged 15-29 years, per 100,000 standard population, age adjusted
description/suicide_age_30_44_per_100000: Mortality due to self-inflicted injury among persons aged 30-44 years, per 100,000 standard population, age adjusted
description/suicide_age_45_59_per_100000: Mortality due to self-inflicted injury among persons aged 45-59 years, per 100,000 standard population, age adjusted
description/suicide_age_60plus_per_10000: Mortality due to self-inflicted injury among persons aged 60+ years, per 100,000 standard population, age adjusted
description/traffic_mortality_children_0: Mortality among children aged 0-14 years due to traffic injury, per 100,000 standard population, age adjusted
description/traffic_mortality_15_29_per_: Mortality among persons aged 15-29 years due to traffic injury, per 100,000 standard population, age adjusted
description/traffic_mortality_30_44_per_: Mortality among persons aged 30-44 years due to traffic injury, per 100,000 standard population, age adjusted
description/traffic_mortality_45_59_per_: Mortality among persons aged 45-59 years due to traffic injury, per 100,000 standard population, age adjusted
description/traffic_mortality_60plus_per: Mortality among persons aged 60+ years due to traffic injury, per 100,000 standard population, age adjusted
description/ifpri_underweight_children: Percent of children under five who are more than two standard deviations below average weight for age.
description/maternal_mortality_ratio_who: The number of maternal deaths divided by the number of live births in a given year, multiplied by 100,000. Maternal death is defined as the death of a women while pregnant or within the 42 days after termination of that pregnancy, regardless of the length and site of the pregnancy, from a cause related to or aggravated by the pregnancy.
description/battle_deaths_per_100_000: Battle deaths, age-adjusted mortality per 100 000 standard population.
description/armed_forces_personnel_total: Armed forces personnel are active duty military personnel, including paramilitary forces if the training, organization, equipment, and control suggest they may be used to support or replace regular military forces.
description/armed_forces_personnel_perce: Armed forces personnel are active duty military personnel, including paramilitary forces if the training, organization, equipment, and control suggest they may be used to support or replace regular military forces. Labor force comprises all people who meet the International Labour Organization's definition of the economically active population.
description/murder_total_deaths: Total number of estimated deaths from interpersonal violence
description/suicide_total_deaths: Total number of estimated deaths from self-inflicted injury
description/traffic_total_deaths: Total number of estimated deaths from road traffic accidents
description/debt_servicing_costs_percent: The sum of principal and interest paid in foreign currency, goods or services on long-term debt, interest paid on short-term debt and repayments to the International Monetary Fund, as a percentage of net exports and income from abroad.
description/external_debt_total_us_not_i: Total external debt is debt owed to nonresidents repayable in foreign currency, goods, or services. Total external debt is the sum of public, publicly guaranteed, and private nonguaranteed long-term debt, use of IMF credit, and short-term debt. Short-term debt includes all debt having an original maturity of one year or less and interest in arrears on long-term debt. Data are in current U. S. dollars. World Bank, Global Development Finance.
description/present_value_of_debt_percen: Present value of debt is the sum of short-term external debt plus the discounted sum of total debt service payments due on public, publicly guaranteed, and private nonguaranteed long-term external debt over the life of existing loans. The GNI denominator is a three-year average.
description/exports_unit_value_index_200: Export values are the current value of exports (f.o.b.) converted to U.S. dollars and expressed as a percentage of the average for the base period (2000). UNCTAD's export value indexes are reported for most economies. For selected economies for which UNCTAD does not publish data, the export value indexes are derived from export volume indexes (line 72) and corresponding unit value indexes of exports (line 74) in the IMF's International Financial Statistics.
description/imports_unit_value_index_200: Import value indexes are the current value of imports (c.i.f.) converted to U.S. dollars and expressed as a percentage of the average for the base period (2000). UNCTAD's import value indexes are reported for most economies. For selected economies for which UNCTAD does not publish data, the import value indexes are derived from import volume indexes (line 73) and corresponding unit value indexes of imports (line 75) in the IMF's International Financial Statistics.
description/net_barter_terms_of_trade_20: Net barter terms of trade is the percentage ratio of the export price index to the corresponding import price index measured relative to the base year 2000.
description/dead_kids_per_woman: How many children a woman has on average that dies before their 35th birthday. It is based on the Total fertilirty rate and age-specific mortality.
description/surviving_kids_per_woman: How many children a woman has on average that survives until their 35th birthday. It is based on the Total fertilirty rate and age-specific mortality.
description/20120905_extreme_poverty_per: WDI 20120905 The percentage of people living on less than $1.25 (2005 purchasing power parity dollars).
description/alternative_gdp_per_capita_p: GDP per capita PPP, in 2005 i$ from World Bank.
GDP per capita PPP, in 2005 i$ from PWT 7.1
description/number_of_child_deaths: The number of children dying before age 5
description/energy_supply_per_person_toe: Total energy supply per person, tonnes of oil equivalent
description/energy_from_solid_biofuels_p: Percent of total energy supply that comes from 'solid biofuels'. Solid biofuels includes 'traditional energy sources' e.g. firewood.
description/residential_energy_use_perce: Percent of total emergy consumption that is used as 'residential consumption'
description/life_expectancy_at_birth_dat: Life expectancy at birth, the data is taken from Institute for health metrics and evaluation
description/alternative_gdp_per_capita_p: GDP per capita PPP, in 2005 i$ from PWT 8.0 (based on rgdpe)
description/life_expectancy_male: Life expectancy at birth, male, with projections
description/life_expectancy_female: Life expectancy at birth, female, with projections
description/gdp_total_yearly_growth: Based on gapminder's GDP per capita, PPP
description/gdp_per_capita_yearly_growth: Based on gapminder's GDP per capita, PPP
description/yearly_co2_emissions_1000_to: Total carbon dioxide emissions from the burning of fossil fuels during the given year (1000 metric tonnes of CO2).
description/child_mortality_0_5_year_old: Death of children under five years of age per 1,000 live births. More years are included in this indicator.
description/number_of_people_in_poverty: Number of the poor population in millions living on less than $1.25 a day at 2005 international prices. Povcal data
description/income_per_person_long_serie: Income per person, version 15, including historical data & projections
description/newborn_mortality_rate_per_1: Neonatal mortality rate. Children dying within the first 28 days per 1000 live births.
description/newborn_deaths: Neonatal deaths Children dying within the first 28 days.
